news_header: Rebels are nearing control of Goma, DRC, with reports of airport capture. The Congolese government insists it remains in charge amid ongoing fighting and looting.
news_text: Rebels are making significant advances towards taking control of Goma in the Democratic Republic of Congo, having reportedly captured the airport. The Congolese government claims it is still in control as fighting continues in parts of the city, with reports of looting of food and medical supplies. The clashes between M23 rebels and government forces have overwhelmed hospitals, leading to protests in the capital, Kinshasa, targeting foreign embassies. Rwanda is accused of supporting the M23 rebels, which it denies. Calls for a ceasefire and peace talks are increasing, with the African Union urging the M23 to disarm. The situation remains tense as casualties rise and diplomatic discussions continue.
